meanings.definition: The seed or fruit of the anise plant, used as a flavoring in cooking and herbal medicine.
meanings.sent1: I added a pinch of aniseed to the soup for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for aniseed to enhance the taste of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The aniseed jumped out of the spice rack and into the pot, eager to add its aroma.
meanings.sent4: The scent of aniseed filled the kitchen, turning it into a fragrant paradise.
meanings.sent5: As I chewed on the aniseed, its sweet and licorice-like taste enveloped my senses.

meanings.definition: A plant of the parsley family, native to the eastern Mediterranean region, cultivated for its aromatic seeds.
meanings.sent1: The aniseed plant in our garden is thriving under the warm sun.
meanings.sent2: Farmers harvest aniseed plants to collect the aromatic seeds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel planted aniseed seeds all over the garden as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The fields of aniseed plants swayed gently in the breeze, releasing their delightful fragrance.
meanings.sent5: Walking through the aniseed fields felt like strolling through a fragrant paradise.
